name: The Life of a Timid Observer: Bill Maher Online Trivia | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Bill's mother was Jewish, but what religion did his father practice?
questions.explanation:
Irish Catholicism.

	Maher would incorporate this 'mixed' marriage into his early stand up routines. Maher was born in New York City in 1956 and was raised in New Jersey.

questions.text: Maher graduated from Cornell University with a degree in political science.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He graduated with a B.A. in English in 1978 from Cornell. He began performing stand up comedy and became the host of the comedy club Catch a Rising Star in 1979.

questions.text: In which film did Maher make his acting debut?
options: Cannibal Women in the Avocado Jungle of Death
questions.explanation:
D.C. Cab

	"D.C. Cab" was released in 1983. A comedy, it starred Adam Baldwin and Mr. T. Maher played Bob, a cab driver. The movie concerned several cabbies who were motivated by the arrival of a new driver.

questions.text: Six days after the cancellation of his television talk show "Politically Incorrect", Maher received the President's Award from the Los Angeles Press Club.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Maher won the award on 2nd June 2002 for championing free speech. "Politically Incorrect" was cancelled amidst a political hailstorm after Maher said that launching missiles towards an enemy many miles away was cowardly.

questions.text: What is the segment of "Real Time with Bill Maher" that usually featured at the end of the show?
questions.explanation:
New Rules.

	"New Rules" was collected in book form under the title "New Rules: Polite Observations from a Timid Observer". They are comedic editorials on recent events in the news. The book was released on 21 July 2005.

questions.text: What was the name of the one-man show that marked Maher's Broadway debut?
questions.explanation:
Victory Begins at Home.

	"Bill Maher: Victory Begins at Home" spent three weeks on Broadway and was nominated for a Tony award. It played at the Virginia Theater and opened on 5 May 2003. It was based on his book "When You Ride Alone, You Ride with bin Laden", which was released in paperback form on 1st August 2005.

questions.text: Bill began hosting an Internet-exclusive talk show on Amazon.com. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
Amazon Fishbowl.

	"Amazon Fishbowl" began on June 1, 2006. A talk show where people promote a new movie, book or music CD, it also features a live musical performance.

questions.text: For which website did Maher become a frequent blogger?
questions.explanation:
The Huffington Post.

	The Huffington Post was started on 9th May 2005, and featured blogs written by a group of regular columnists and less-frequent guests, one of whom was Maher. It is to the left of the American political spectrum.

questions.text: "Real Time With Bill Maher" was also available as a podcast.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The 67th episode aired on 23rd February 2006, and was the first episode available for download. The podcast enabled the late-night talk show to reach a wider audience, and was available weekly.

questions.text: Maher publicly begged Ralph Nader to drop out of the 2004 presidential race.
questions.explanation:
True.

	This happened on the set of "Real Time", and Maher was joined in this act by filmmaker Michael Moore. Ralph Nader has run for president in 2000 and 2004.
